name: Glenn
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This was a great private getaway from all the crowds while on a crane watching trip. The river was just down from the cabin as described and the property was great for a little hiking and exploring. We brought all of our food for cooking at the cabin and the kitchen was well stocked with everything we needed for food prep.
Towels and linens were clean and sufficient. There was a nice supply of board games for a rainy day, 3 SmartTV's, and a pair of binoculars for checking out any wildlife you may see at a distance. We definitely heard the wild animals in the middle of the night, but it justed added to the ambiance.
Check-in/out instructions were easy to follow.
Dishwasher, washer and dryer, coffee pot [cone filters], toaster were available and functioning
TIP: Arrive with your food, as the property is as described, off the beaten path. I imagine you will have a bit of a drive to the nearest grocery store if you didn't plan ahead. We were prepared for, and loved the seclusion.

review_text:
This place is a gem. My girlfriend and I attended a nearby bull sale and it really couldnâ€™t get any closer. This place is quiet, private, and very spacious. The floor plan is super open and there is a ton of room to spread out. It more than accommodated just the 2 of us and could very easily host a multi-family stay. John was easy to work with and the self check-in with the keypad is a breeze. Do plan to bring your own food as there is not much other than condiments and town is a good distance away. You can definitely cook anything youâ€™d want. There are pots, pans, cookie sheets, a crockpot, etc. The included washer dryer is also nice, we were able to run a load with little issue.
Do be wary of wildlife however. We arrived after dark and there were definitely critters hanging out on the front step when we tried to get in. Not a problem, just an observation. You should expect such things when staying in the Sandhills! 10/10, really canâ€™t go wrong here.

name: Daniel
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
August 2023
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: This riverside home was everything we hoped for...and more! It is pretty secluded (which suited us great!), in a beautiful part of Nebraska, surrounded by hills, trees, fields, and wildflowers. We brought our two little guys (3yrs and 1.5yrs) and they had great fun romping in the yard and playing on the front porch. The river is accessible but not so close to the house as to make it worrisome for little people who can't swim. A nice little clearing by the river, surrounded by towering cottonwoods, holds a zipline, swing, and slack line that make for great fun. The house itself is clean and beautiful ("magical" and "refreshing" were two words that kept popping up in our vocabulary while we were there), with a well-thought-out layout and a crisp decorating style that is chic while being very kid-friendly at the same time. We are already talking about coming back! We highly recommend this place and its hosts. Thanks for a great stay, John and Mandy!

I was hoping to use the gym and washer/dryer, but didn't see until it was too late that I would have needed to get that figured out ahead of time. Since we were only staying one night, I didn't bother reaching out once I figured out I needed to request access.
Overall, I would definitely recommend and would stay there again with a large group.

Not only was the location great for that - it's about 15-20 minutes to great sites for bird watching - but the house is an absolute treasure. It was spotless, with plenty of space to sleep the six of us, and Gordon and Elizabeth were super helpful and flexible when we ran into last minute dog sitting problems. It's a very dog friendly house, just be aware there's no fence and you'll need to bring a lead if you want to let your dog hang out outside. The weather was snowy and icy while we were there, but the house was well outfitted with deicer and the driveway was shoveled really quickly.

We saw about 320,000 of them lift off from Rowe Sanctuary in the early dawn. The experience gave all of us goosebumps (bird pun intended) and we made lasting memories. We all appreciated the little "bird-y" touches throughout the house from the crane photo to the avian bric-a-brac. If you stay here, be prepared to want to take the couch home--it's wonderfully comfortable. The furniture in general is designed to make you feel at home and the seating arrangements are thoughtful. Thanks for a great stay!

The house is in the middle of town, so it took us about five minutes to get anywhere. The kitchen is well-equipped. The living room has a big couch and a comfortable recliner, plus a big TV and board games. The beds are comfortable. It snowed while we were there, so we really appreciated the enclosed porch in the back where the kids could keep their boots and coats. The house was very clean. It was perfect.

Stayed with kids
review_text:
We had a wonderful family experience.
The kitchen was well stocked with cooking utensils and items such as spices and some condiments in the fridge. We enjoyed the game area in the basement and the front porch with chairs and a porch swing to sit out and enjoy the nice weather as well as the fenced in back area with the grill, table and firepit.
Bedrooms were spacious and sitting areas on upper level were a bonus. There were no unbreakable dishes or glasses for small children so you may want to bring them as well as storage containers for left overs.
It was great to be just a block away from a reasonably priced grocery store as well as a few blocks from a Walgreens.
The host responded immediately to any questions we had which we greatly appreciated.
The city of Kearney is amazing especially considering its size. We thoroughly enjoyed the Children's Museum, park with 3 playground areas, walking trail around a lake, and observation tower and very nice bike trail which went for several miles.
We would definitely consider staying again and it was centrally located for our family from Colorado and eastern Iowa.

Very nice Boho -- the owners are definitely taking good care of the place and put a lot of effort in upgrading it
The location is in a more "industrial" side of town with a few trains that we were not used to...but this should not change our mind about selecting this place.
I like the fenced in backyard -- this helped our pooch feel more comfortable
We do like our coffee in the morning (and we are older generation) so a standard coffee maker on site would be great. Using the Keurig is not my favorite appliance. Luckily we had some instant coffee and did try to use the Keurig machine
A suggestion - this would be a great place for the crane watchers that come into town in Early March into April -- since the location is so close to the best places for cranewatching along the Platte -- you should advertise this! It was so convenient for us.
I love all your improvements to the house -- they made it very comfortable.

The inside is very clean and nicely divided into different areas, sleeping, kitchen, living; has all the amenities, including some games, having coffee available, and some left-behind non-perishables from previous guests. She and Joey provide great local recommendations; we tried many and loved them all. Both are very responsive and provide proactive, timely and clear communications. We were there to take in the sandhill crane migration: breathtaking! And we felt very comfortable coming and going. While we did not spend time in the private yard, it looks inviting and like a great space in warmer weather. Weâ€™d definitely come and stay here again!

The kitchen is well stocked with what we needed to make a few meals. They even had some bathroom things in case we forgot. Everything is easy to find and figure out. The bed was comfy too. Plenty of pillows and blankets.
It was a short trip to the fair grounds in Kearney for the teamster events we attended, and not too far from the State Fair in Grand Island. We found plenty to do over the weekend. If we're ever in the area again, we will for sure book this cozy place!
Side note: We had a wheel bearing go out on our car. The garage about a block away was super friendly and got us fixed up quickly! The walking distance there was an unexpected huge plus for this trip!

review_text:
This little place was super cute on the inside and very clean! The beds were comfortable and the little kitchen had what we needed for a quick, overnight stay. You can tell they put a lot of effort into making it a comfortable space.
There were a few challenges, though. There are only 2 AC units in the cottage which leave the kitchen & bathroom/laundry room very warm. The AC unit in the living room cools only enough to make the room temperate. I would advise you bring several fans with you to make your stay more comfortable in the summer months.
Though the landlords have no control over the next items, it's good to be aware before you arrive: the neighborhood is rather industrial and a little sketchy looking/feeling. Which feeling is unfortunately augmented by some very unfriendly neighbors that share the driveway with cottage renters. Since street parking is allowed, I would advise you leave your car on the curb so as to avoid the neighbors' space altogether.

This was a great little place to stay on a roadtrip passing through. It was clean, beautiful and had everything you'd need (and more!). The bathroom is stocked with toiletries (even bath bombs), the kitchen with snacks (and a freezer full of veggies, meat and fruit). The swings in the back are a great way to relax after a long day of driving. The bed was comfortable, everything was really clean and they had a fun (and hard!) puzzle that I did watching movies.
Joey was responsive and super kind and friendly. Other than being in a lower end of town with train tracks right outside, it was awesome. (The trains never blast the horn, just rattle by periodically).
As a single woman traveling alone, I always question safety. I felt a little uneasy when I first got there due to the lower end neighborhood by the tracks, but realized pretty quickly it was just the small town feel, not an unsafe neighborhood in the city.

Lots of windows and a front and side door with screens. The inside is beautifully furnished and decorated. Nice bathroom with nice toiletries and bath extras. Private, calming. I felt very comfortable. Just my style. Wish I had more time to enjoy the hammock and hanging chairs in the yard. There is a freight train that passes close by. No horn, but you can hear the train. I'm sensitive to noise but it wasn't an issue at all, more of a nostalgic part of the experience. Joey is a great communicator and very responsive. I enjoyed the stay very much!

We enjoyed the secret garden, what the jars of grape jelly were for, the Sandhill crane sculptures, the Jon Crane artwork & more! Thank you guys for your kindness & hospitality! Mary and Chuck were super-super-super mega hosts! From personalized welcome signs and our own newsletter to plush robes laid out to wear after shower or spa, every detail was perfect. Even though our suite was private and complete, Chuck and Mary were at our beck and call for every need.
Beds were super clean and comfy, fridge was stocked with drinks, snacks were available, and brochures and pamphlets for all the places we might be inclined to go were out. Chuck, member of the historical board, even gave us a tour. Heritage House is a trip in itself - there is so much history there.
We came to see cranes and see them we did. We got beautiful pictures and wonderful videos. We were about fifteen minutes from Rowe Sanctuary and even closer to Fort Kearney, both awesome viewing areas.
Chuck and Mary attended every detail and more than earn the highest rating possible and then some. They and their home were awesome. We would all highly recommend the Heritage House for your next stay.

name: Brent

Rating, 5 stars

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Awesome airbnb! I highly recommend this property.
Chuck and Mary are great hosts; friendly, welcoming, and have put a lot of effort into making a guest's stay pleasant. It's a historic old home, but doesn't feel like the typical old home, didn't have the creaks and things typical old homes have. Was sound and quiet.
They personally welcomed us even though we arrived late and showed us where to park (plenty of parking) and took us on a tour of the home. Also wished us a good morning each morning and made sure we had everything we needed.
The set up is awesome, three bedrooms that are separate from their living area, and also separated pretty good from the other guest rooms. Chuck and Mary had welcome signs and gifts for us; there's a coffee bar, a mini fridge, a tv, and nice sitting area. Beds are very comfortable. Nice patio area with covered pergola. Internet was just fine.
The bathroom is clean and fully stocked with linens and essentials. Honestly, I've typically been more of a hotel traveler because I like the conveniences of coffee, fully stocked bathrooms, etc that can be hit and miss at airbnbs. All those luxuries are taken care of at Chuck and Mary's.
One of my travel companions is a frequent airbnb user and commented this is the best airbnb he's seen. If we're every back in the Kearney area we'll be staying at Chuck and Mary's and I recommend you do to.

review_text:
The house is really easy to find, pretty secluded location, and super cozy. The house itself has a rustic charm that is very endearing, we loved spending time there. Bonus points because we had a HUGE flyover of American White Pelicans both mornings about 9:30. Literally thousands of birds. It was breath taking. We had a little trouble with the Wi-Fi, Rachel knew exactly how to fix it, gave clear instructions, and it worked perfectly. She also brought us some emergency coffee because we were out, 5 star host indeed.
It is a little close to the highway as some other reviews have pointed out, but it is not bothersome at all. My wife and I still enjoyed the hot tub both evenings and mornings, even got a visit from the neighbor's cat (neighbor's house is well over a hundred yards away and on the other side of a big stand of trees) who is super lovey.
Overall a great place to stay, everything works, it was clean, well maintained. We will definitely be staying there again.

Stayed one night
review_text:
Very cute! Nice, rustic feel. I really liked the corrugated steel walls in bathroom and on ceiling.
Nice location with a country feel surrounded by tall grasses, trees and a mowed walking path. While you can hear the traffic from I-80, it was far enough back that it didn't bother much while outside. Outside amenities include swingset, deck / lanai, firepit, extra chairs, decorative lights and a 2-3 person hot tub.
We enjoyed the hot tub after dark; the deck lights made for a nice ambience. Loft was roomy; two adult daughters slept there; I slept on the couch-bed combo.
Very nice space. Caveat for those with adult / teens; the bunkbeds are made for small children, not those past puberty. That said, the top bunk looks like a single full sized mattress might fit.
My only complaint was that I felt the need to dust the ceiling fan before using it; otherwise, a great place, nice location and lovely country / rustic feel with modern accommodations.

A portion of the road to get there is gravel, but easily managed with any vehicle. Beds were comfortable and amenities were as described; the place was adorable. The loft bed even had fairy lights! The place is close to the hwy, which was convenient, but situated so you don't hear any of the traffic noise at all, making it a relaxing and peaceful stay! We headed out early, but got to see an amazing sunrise beyond the trees! Would definitely stay here again! :)

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
The host was kind and helpful. The tiny home was cute on the outside. We could not really hang outside unfortunately, we got attacked by mosquitoes and headed inside. Even inside after keeping the door closed it had many insects that got in.
We ended up having to set up our baby tent to utilize the net mesh to protect our toddler and ourselves from being bitten at night by the mosquitoes. We didnâ€™t get the full experience of this place unfortunately because of that.
Another issue we encountered was the water. Not sure if there is a filter or if you could add one but the water was grey and smelled like sulfur. We skipped baths and showers. And took off right away when the sun came up.
The bugs got into our van too. We see why the area is filled with birds, lots of snacks for them. We are so sad our experience was not the best.
Pluses are we appreciated the tv and dvd set up as it helped calm our toddler after a long road trip. It had a cute space for kiddos and the loft space.

Iâ€™ve stayed in numerous Tiny Houses, and this one is especially nice in terms of design and layout. Has many amenities for a Tiny House. This is one of the rare designs with a staircase built in, so no ladder, but you will need to step up carefully and then crawl the last few feet to the bed, so keep this in mind. so for anyone wanting to try the Tiny House experience, this one is not to be missed. The triple bunk beds for little kiddos was adorable. it's a nice space back there and we used it to store all our bags and as a dressing room. The kitchen was very clean & easy to use. The bathroom was surprisingly roomy and the shower was great. Towels and linens were very high quality. My husband and I stayed on the converted couch which was nice and firm. We slept really well. My sister slept in the upstairs loft which was very cool and comfortable for her, just needed to be careful walking back down. We had everything we needed and the location was great for going out to see the crane migration (April). The host was super nice and we were very pleased.

name: Viola
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
March 2023
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
We were there for one night, so the house was clearly too big for us (but WAY better than staying in a hotel). Everything was cozy, clean and easy to figure out. If you are a larger group, you will like the bedroom space, especially if the kids can hang out downstairs in a separate living room area. The kitchen is small, with a tiny table for two. There is a folding table that can be used. For two, the kitchen space was fine. For a large group, it would be less helpful. The backyard space is great for kids/doggos.
A coffee table is needed in the main living room area. The garage was the main reason I wanted the house, since our truck was fully loaded. I should have confirmed the space size as our pickup truck didn't fit. Note that the house sits on a busy road, but road noise wasn't a problem.
The one big negative - I would strongly advise the owners to forego their political views, featured as the password to the house and their wifi password. Enough already.

review_text:
This house was a great alternative to a hotel stay for our extended family that came into town, from different areas, to attend a wedding. Great communication with the hosts, everything is as represented in the listing. The home was clean and updated, beds were comfy, plenty of towels and extra blankets, etc., lots of space for congregating and visitingâ€”upstairs and in the basementâ€”with enough room for having your privacy when needed.
As a pet-friendly BnB, the fenced back yard was a perfect area for our furry family members to safely romp and play and have some outdoor time without the need of a leash. Lots of off-street parking area in the driveway, thoughtful touches throughout like bottled water in the fridge, a snack basket in the kitchen, and essential oil diffuser in family room.
We would definitely stay here again the next time a family event brings us to Kearney.
Thank you Shad and Ceann!

We had a family trip to watch the bird migration and this was a wonderful place to stay. It was stocked with amenities, like lots of Keurig cups, shower supplies, and condiments. It was very comfortable, we used all 4 bedrooms. It was clean and nicely decorated.
The basement had 1 of the bedrooms and bathrooms plus a second living room with a large TV. It was noticeably cooler down there but we all slept well. Plus it has train art on the walls down there and my 5 year old son was in heaven that he got to sleep there.
The hosts were communicative and very nice. It was easy to come and go and we were happy we could use the garage. It was an added bonus that they don't require you to do a ton of cleaning and laundry before you leave. They make it easy on the guests.

This place is adorable and the beds are really comfortable. The living room has a very warm â€œhomeâ€ vibe. Sitting on the couch watching TV felt like I was at home.
The area for our pets was awesome. It took a load of stress off letting our pets roam the yard without worrying they would get out.
We ended up missing our reservation date completely and showed up an entire day late. They first emailed me asking if everything was alright because they were worried about us. They then worked with us and let us stay on the date we got into town instead of when we had reserved it. They could have held us to our date and charged us extra but they were very kind and generous.
They are people I would gladly do business with again and the house is adorable. What else can you ask for?
